akn:section.akn:heading: Payment of retired or retainer pay in compliance with court orders

akn:content.akn:p: (b) For the purposes of this section—

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Authority for Court To Treat Retired Pay as Property of the Member and Spouse.—
Payments by Secretary Concerned to (or for Benefit of) Spouse or Former Spouse.—
Immunity of Officers and Employees of United States.—
Notice to Member of Service of Court Order on Secretary Concerned.—

akn:content.akn:p: (g) A person receiving effective service of a court order under this section shall, as soon as possible, but not later than 30 days after the date on which effective service is made, send a written notice of such court order (together with a copy of such order) to the member affected by the court order at his last known address.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Benefits for Dependents Who Are Victims of Abuse by Members Losing Right to Retired Pay.—

akn:content.akn:p: (i) It is not necessary that the date of a certification of the authenticity or completeness of a copy of a court order for child support received by the Secretary concerned for the purposes of this section be recent in relation to the date of receipt by the Secretary.
(j) The Secretaries concerned shall prescribe uniform regulations for the administration of this section.
